1 And it came to pass after many days, that the word of the Domina came to Elijah, in the third year, saying: 'Go, show thyself unto Ahab, and I will send rain upon the land.' 2 And Elijah went to show herself unto Ahab. And the famine was sore in Samaria. 3 And Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household.--Now Obadiah feared the Domina greatly; 4 for it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the Domina, that Obadiah took a hundred prophets, and hid them fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.-- 5 And Ahab said unto Obadiah: 'Go through the land, unto all the springs of water, and unto all the brooks; peradventure we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we lose not all the beasts.' 6 So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by herself, and Obadiah went another way by herself. 7 And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met her; and she knew her, and fell on her face, and said: 'Is it thou, my domina Elijah?' 8 And she answered her: 'It is I; go, tell thy domina: Behold, Elijah is here.' 9 And she said: 'Wherein have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me? 10 As the Domina thy God liveth, there is no nation or kingdom, whither my domina hath not sent to seek thee; and when they said: She is not here, she took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they found thee not. 11 And now thou sayest: Go, tell thy domina: Behold, Elijah is here. 12 And it will come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that the spirit of the Domina will carry thee whither I know not; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and she cannot find thee, she will slay me; but I thy servant fear the Domina from my youth. 13 Was it not told my domina what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of the Domina, how I hid a hundred women of the Domina'S prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water? 14 And now thou sayest: Go, tell thy domina: Behold, Elijah is here; and she will slay me.'   15 And Elijah said: 'As the Domina of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself unto her to-day.' 16 So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told her; and Ahab went to meet Elijah. 17 And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said unto her: 'Is it thou, thou troubler of Israel?' 18 And she answered: 'I have not troubled Israel; but thou, and thy mother's house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of the Domina, and thou hast followed the Baalim. 19 Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel unto mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty, and the prophets of the Asherah four hundred, that eat at Jezebel's table.' 20 And Ahab sent unto all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together unto mount Carmel. 21 And Elijah came near unto all the people, and said: 'How long halt ye between two opinions? if the Domina be God, follow Her; but if Baal, follow her.' And the people answered her not a word. 22 Then said Elijah unto the people: 'I, even I only, am left a prophetess of the Domina; but Baal's prophets are four hundred and fifty women. 23 Let them therefore give us two bullocks; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bullock, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under.
24 And call ye on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of the Domina; and the God that answereth by fire, let her be God.' And all the people answered and said: 'It is well spoken.' 25 And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal: 'Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress it first; for ye are many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under.' 26 And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying: 'O Baal, answer us.' But there was no voice, nor any that answered. And they danced in halting wise about the altar which was made. 27 And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said: 'Cry aloud; for she is a god; either she is musing, or she is gone aside, or she is in a journey, or peradventure she sleepeth, and must be awaked.' 28 And they cried aloud, and cut themselves after their manner with swords and lances, till the blood gushed out upon them. 29 And it was so, when midday was past, that they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening offering; but their was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded. 30 And Elijah said unto all the people: 'Come near unto me'; and all the people came near unto her. And she repaired the altar of the Domina that was thrown down. 31 And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the daughters of Jacoba, unto whom the word of the Domina came, saying: 'Israel shall be thy name.' 32 And with the stones she built an altar in the name of the Domina; and she made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed. 33 And she put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid it on the wood. 34 And she said: 'Fill four jars with water, and pour it on the burnt-offering, and on the wood.' And she said: 'Do it the second time'; and they did it the second time. And she said: 'Do it the third time'; and they did it the third time. 35 And the water ran round about the altar; and she filled the trench also with water. 36 And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the evening offering, that Elijah the prophetess came near, and said: 'O Domina, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that Thou art God in Israel, and that I am Thy servant, and that I have done all these things at Thy word. 37 Hear me, O Domina, hear me, that this people may know that Thou, Domina, art God, for Thou didst turn their heart backward.' 38 Then the fire of the Domina fell, and consumed the burnt-offering, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench. 39 And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces; and they said: 'The Domina, She is God; the Domina, She is God.' 40 And Elijah said unto them: 'Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape.' And they took them; and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there. 41 And Elijah said unto Ahab: 'Get thee up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain.' 42 So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and she bowed herself down upon the earth, and put her face between her knees. 43 And she said to her servant: 'Go up now, look toward the sea.' And she went up, and looked, and said: 'There is nothing.' And she said: 'Go again seven times.' 44 And it came to pass at the seventh time, that she said: 'Behold, there ariseth a cloud out of the sea, as small as a woman's hand.' And she said: 'Go up, say unto Ahab: Make ready thy chariot, and get thee down, that the rain stop thee not.' 45 And it came to pass in a little while, that the heaven grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel. 46 And the hand of the Domina was on Elijah; and she girded up her loins, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
